articles.title: 'Will Holloway or Oliveira JUMP THE LINE?!' | UFC 326 BMF  Preview
articles.description: UFC 326 is set for Las Vegas and the BMF belt is on the line as Max Holloway defends against former lightweight champion Charles Oliveira in a highly anticipated rematch. Their first meeting in 2015 ended early due to injury, but both men are now veterans, champions, and among the most dangerous finishers in the sport. Holloway enters as the BMF champion and one of the greatest featherweights of all time, known for elite boxing, pace, and durability. Oliveira, the most prolific finisher in UFC history, brings dangerous submissions, knockout power, and relentless pressure. Both fighters are chasing one more run at undisputed gold ‚Äî and a statement win here could change the title picture. Full breakdown of Holloway vs Oliveira 2, the BMF belt stakes, legacy implications, and the rest of the UFC 326 fight card. üîí Become a Member for special Perks, Exclusive Content and ultra-exclusive Live Chats: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDrG2_1TcVkXKXXsD6Kjwig/join ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Follow Michael on Social: https://www.instagram.com/mikebisping https://www.twitter.com/bisping https://www.facebook.com/mikethecountbisping ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Edited by John Brannigan: https://www.instagram.com/johnbranniganuk https://www.twitter.com/johnbranniganuk #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews #ufc326 #charlesoliveira #armantsarukyan #iliatopuria #maxholloway #justingaethje #paddypimblett

articles.title: Sean Strickland Broke Every Rule, And Won Anyway‚Ä¶
articles.description: Sean Strickland has broken every rule in the book. You‚Äôre not supposed to: * Get married and get tougher. * Get rich and get hungrier. * Start coaching and improve your own career. But Sean did. Chael shares personal stories from sparring Strickland at 21 years old ‚Äî when nobody knew what he even was. Wrestler? Jiu-jitsu guy? Kickboxer? t took years ‚Äî and a 25-minute dismantling of Israel Adesanya ‚Äî to realize what Sean truly is. Chael also breaks down: * Angry Sean vs Calm Sean * Why the underdog role unlocks something different * The missed opportunity with Dricus Du Plessis (Part 2) * Why the Khamzat Chimaev situation has him furious Most fighters get softer with success. Sean Strickland got sharper. And that‚Äôs rare. articles.title: Did Strickland Just Become #1? #ufc
articles.description: The middleweight division just got complicated. The manager for Khamzat Chimaev made it clear ‚Äî they want the winner of Strickland vs Hernandez. Fair enough. Let the fight decide it. Well‚Ä¶ it did. Sean Strickland wins. So is that the end of the debate? Not so fast. Nassourdine Imavov is still in the mix. And here‚Äôs the twist ‚Äî Imavov‚Äôs last loss came against Strickland. If these two were neck-and-neck in the rankings, the head-to-head already gave us an answer. So what do you do? Option one: Strickland just became the clear number one contender and the obvious fight for Chimaev. Option two: Imavov quietly already has something lined up behind the scenes, and this is all optics. Option three: the UFC slows it down and lets the division breathe. But here‚Äôs what history says under the Ultimate Fighting Championship banner: when things are close, they let the cage decide. And the cage already spoke. Strickland thrives when doubted. Chimaev thrives on chaos. Stylistically, that‚Äôs pressure vs pressure. Cardio vs pace. Mental warfare vs relentless offense. The question isn‚Äôt who deserves it. The question is whether the UFC sees Strickland as the bigger moment. Because if he is‚Ä¶ that fight gets made next. Subscribe for daily UFC analysis, matchmaking breakdowns, and real contender talk. #UFC #KhamzatChimaev #SeanStrickland #Imavov #UFCMiddleweight #MMA #FightNews #Contender #CombatSports

articles.title: Eddie Hearn F*cked Up
articles.description: Eddie Hearn did the one thing you cannot do when dealing with Dana White. He called out ‚Äúthe boss.‚Äù After losing a top fighter to Zuffa Boxing, Eddie didn‚Äôt just lose the round ‚Äî he questioned whether Dana answers to someone else. Chael explains why that‚Äôs a strategic error. Dana doesn‚Äôt shy away from battles. In fact, he wants resistance. He expected a fight when he made his move for Ben. Instead, he got signed paperwork. That disappointed him. But when Eddie publicly suggested Dana has a ‚Äúdaddy‚Äù ‚Äî that‚Äôs not business. That‚Äôs personal. This isn‚Äôt about who‚Äôs right. It‚Äôs about understanding who you‚Äôre dealing with. articles.title: Strickland Shocks Hernandez #ufc
articles.description: When nobody believes in him, that‚Äôs when Sean Strickland is at his most dangerous. Strickland takes out Anthony Hernandez via TKO ‚Äî and the story isn‚Äôt fatigue. It isn‚Äôt luck. It isn‚Äôt timing. It‚Äôs experience. Main event reps matter. Former champion composure matters. Strickland has been under the lights, in five-round fights, in championship rounds. When things get tense, he doesn‚Äôt rush. He doesn‚Äôt break. He leans into it. And here‚Äôs the pattern: when the world doubts him, when analysts question him, when fans write him off ‚Äî he performs his best. No pressure. No expectation. Just execution. Hernandez is tough. Aggressive. Dangerous. But there‚Äôs a difference between being a contender and having championship seasoning. That gap showed up when it mattered most. So what now? Does Strickland jump back into title contention? Does he become the gatekeeper to the elite? Or does this performance put him right back in the middleweight championship picture under the Ultimate Fighting Championship banner? One thing is clear: if you count Sean Strickland out, you‚Äôre playing a risky game. And history says he thrives in that spot. Subscribe for daily UFC breakdowns, fight analysis, and real MMA debate. #UFC #SeanStrickland #AnthonyHernandez #MMA #UFCMiddleweight #FightBreakdown #CombatSports #UFCNews #MMADebate

articles.title: ‚ÄúLet The Old Guys Go!‚Äù DJ Rolls With Urijah Faber ü§º
Pereira Fighting For Heavyweight Gold? #ufc
articles.description: There‚Äôs one thing I‚Äôm very confident about: Alex Pereira is going to be on the White House card. And I‚Äôm very confident it‚Äôs for a title. The real question isn‚Äôt if he fights. It‚Äôs where. Does Pereira defend at 205? Or does he move up and fight for the heavyweight championship? If Tom Aspinall isn‚Äôt ready ‚Äî and all signs suggest that timeline is tight ‚Äî then in theory the opportunity shifts toward Ciryl Gane. But here‚Äôs where it gets interesting. If we‚Äôre talking interim belt, does that really count in the history books? Does that carry the same weight? Does that headline a once-in-a-generation event? Because historically, when the UFC heavyweight title is contested under the Ultimate Fighting Championship banner, it closes the show. Always. The heavyweight championship doesn‚Äôt get placed underneath another fight. So if Pereira is on that card, and it‚Äôs for gold, logic says we‚Äôre not talking interim. We‚Äôre talking undisputed. That changes everything. A two-division champion moving up to heavyweight for undisputed gold? That‚Äôs legacy-defining. That‚Äôs the kind of moment that reshapes pound-for-pound debates and permanently alters a career. If this meeting produces news, don‚Äôt be surprised if it‚Äôs Pereira preparing for the biggest fight of his life ‚Äî at heavyweight. Watch closely. This could be historic. #UFC #AlexPereira #Heavyweight #UFCTitle #TomAspinall #CirylGane #MMA #UFCNews #FightBusiness #CombatSports

articles.title: Uros Medic Gets a Call from Trump & Calls Out Leon Edwards! | BYM INTERVIEW
articles.description: Uros Medic joins the podcast after his stunning first-round knockout of Jeff Neal in Houston. The Serbian powerhouse breaks down the finish, explains how he hurt Neal in the first exchange, and reveals the surreal moment he received a congratulatory phone call from former President Donald Trump after the fight. Medic also discusses his immigration situation, the possibility of fighting on the UFC White House card, and why he wants to beat former champions like Leon Edwards, Belal Muhammad, and Jack Della Maddalena on his path to the belt. Plus, thoughts on Ian Machado Garry, fighting in Serbia, and what it means to represent his country on the global stage. A breakout performance, a viral microphone moment, and now the Top 15 ‚Äî Uros Medic is coming. FULL EPISODE @bispingpodcast #bisping #ufc #mma #mixedmartialarts #michaelbisping #ufcnews #mmanews #ufchouston #urosmedic #leonedwards

articles.title: Dana Wants Chimaev to Defend, But Pereira Can Move Up
articles.description: Dana White made two very different statements over the weekend. He said Khamzat Chimaev should defend. He said he has no problem with Alex Pereira going up. Those are not the same situation. Chimaev hasn‚Äôt defended. He has real contenders waiting in Nassourdine Imavov and Sean Strickland History says: you defend before you chase champ-champ. But Pereira? Different story... Chael breaks down: * Why relinquishing matters (like Ilia Topuria did) * Why holding two divisions hostage doesn‚Äôt help anyone * The White House card rumors * The possible heavyweight matchup with Ciryl Gane * The interim title scenario with Tom Aspinall sidelined If Pereira goes up ‚Äî and Chael believes he will ‚Äî he should relinquish. Move on completely. History favors that move. articles.title: Chimaev Has NO Choice‚Ä¶Sean Strickland‚Äôs Next
articles.description: Get $10 Off at BRUNT with code CHAEL https://www.bruntworkwear.com/CHAEL at #Bruntpod There‚Äôs no debate anymore. Khamzat Chimaev must fight Sean Strickland next. Chael breaks down why this fight makes sense from every angle ‚Äî rankings, integrity, entertainment, and the behind-the-scenes tension nobody wants to talk about. Strickland says he ran Khamzat out of the gym. Khamzat says he destroyed a man who beat Sean twice. That‚Äôs not just drama ‚Äî that‚Äôs promotional gold. We also look at where Nassourdine Imavov fits in, the rumors about Khamzat walking around at 230 pounds, and why talk of 205 (and even calling out Alex Pereira and Jiri Prochazka) might signal something bigger. Plus: Sean Strickland is the Brunt Boot Athlete of the Week. If the UFC doesn‚Äôt book this fight next ‚Äî what exactly are we doing? articles.title: Dana White BLASTS Eddie Hearn After Signing Conor Benn üò≥üî•
articles.description: Dana White didn‚Äôt hold back when reacting to Eddie Hearn after Conor Benn left Matchroom and moved to Zuffa Boxing. Dana refers to beating Eddie Hearn in the Conor Benn negotiation as: ‚Äú I am really beating up babies.‚Äù He also added that Benn ‚Äúmade more money‚Äù and that Hearn ‚Äúhad the right to match it‚Ä¶ He could have matched it.‚Äù Dana‚Äôs stance was clear ‚Äî this was business. articles.title: Sean Strickland Just Blew Up the UFC Middleweight Division
articles.description: Get $10 Off at BRUNT with code CHAEL https://www.bruntworkwear.com/CHAEL at #Bruntpod Sean Strickland stops Anthony Hernandez via TKO ‚Äî and now the UFC has a real problem. Strickland was a meaningful underdog going in. But if you‚Äôve followed his career, you know that‚Äôs when he does his best work. Doubt fuels him. Now the middleweight division is in a strange spot. We all believed Nassourdine Imavov was next for Khamzat Chimaev. It made sense. It felt lined up. But Chimaev‚Äôs manager said they‚Äôre watching the winner of Strickland vs. Hernandez. Well‚Ä¶ Strickland won. Here‚Äôs the issue: Strickland already beat Imavov head-to-head. And in every sport in the world, head-to-head competition is the number one seeding criteria. So what does the UFC do now? Is Imavov already promised the shot? Or did Strickland just force himself back into contender status? articles.title: Dean The Great vs Tiki: What Really Happened #ufc
articles.description: This wasn‚Äôt about hype. It wasn‚Äôt about clout. It was about escalation ‚Äî and how fast it can go wrong. When Dean ‚ÄúThe Great‚Äù stepped into an altercation with Tiki Ghosn, things crossed a line quickly. Words turned into threats. And once someone tells you they‚Äôre about to harm you, the situation changes. Here‚Äôs what most people missed. Tiki didn‚Äôt throw wild punches. He didn‚Äôt unload with bare hands. He chose an elbow ‚Äî fast, direct, controlled. In a street setting, with no wraps and no gloves, a full-force punch can do serious damage to both people. An elbow ends it immediately. It‚Äôs aggressive, yes ‚Äî but it‚Äôs decisive. And decisive matters. Even more important? Dean apologized afterward. That part says a lot. Because once you threaten someone physically ‚Äî especially someone older, experienced, and trained ‚Äî you force a response. At that point, it‚Äôs no longer posturing. It‚Äôs self-defense. This wasn‚Äôt about winning. It was about stopping something before it got worse. There‚Äôs a lesson here about ego, escalation, and understanding who you‚Äôre dealing with before things go too far. In fight culture, respect still matters ‚Äî and so does accountability. Watch more fight analysis, combat sports breakdowns, and real fight talk here. #MMA #DeanTheGreat #TikiGhosn #CombatSports #FightNews #FightBreakdown #Boxing #MMACommunity #FightCulture

articles.title: Bigger Star Right Now: Ilia or Islam? #ufc
articles.description: The biggest debate in fight business right now isn‚Äôt who wins in the cage ‚Äî it‚Äôs who sells the most outside of it. When you compare Ilia Topuria and Islam Makhachev, you‚Äôre talking about dominance vs momentum, legacy vs surge, and global reach vs breakout star power. Right now, Islam has the resume, title defenses, and long-term dominance that traditionally builds superstars inside the Ultimate Fighting Championship. He represents stability at the top, elite skill, and championship consistency ‚Äî things that historically translate to main event trust from promoters. But Ilia is something different. He‚Äôs momentum. He‚Äôs highlight finishes. He‚Äôs personality plus performance. And in modern fight sports, viral moments, confidence, and crossover appeal can accelerate star power fast. The danger in booking them too early is simple: one loses momentum, and the company usually protects rising draws carefully. The real answer might be simpler than people think. Put them on the same card. Whoever headlines is the bigger commercial star at that moment. That‚Äôs how fight business has always worked. Until that happens, this debate stays theoretical. But if they ever share a card, the promotion will tell you exactly who moves the needle more. Watch more fight analysis, matchmaking breakdowns, and insider fight business takes here. #UFC #MMA #IliaTopuria #IslamMakhachev #FightBusiness #MMAStars #CombatSports #UFCNews #MMADebate

articles.title: Jake Paul Might Change The Fight Game #ufc
articles.description: The fight world might be looking at this the wrong way. The real story isn‚Äôt celebrity crossover. The real story is Jake Paul stepping into the MMA business ‚Äî and possibly doing it with real distribution power behind him. This isn‚Äôt about one big spectacle fight. This is about infrastructure. If Jake Paul is working alongside Netflix while exploring MMA, that changes how fights are delivered, marketed, and consumed. The traditional model built by Ultimate Fighting Championship is based on event stacking, rankings, and title pathways. Jake‚Äôs model historically focuses on big moments, viral matchups, and crossover audiences. If that approach enters MMA full-time, it could mean fewer ‚Äúfiller fights‚Äù and more event-driven super fights. It could also create bidding wars for talent and completely reshape how fighters negotiate paydays and exposure. That‚Äôs the part people aren‚Äôt talking about yet ‚Äî but fighters, managers, and promoters definitely are. The takeaway is simple: if this moves from big fight business into actual MMA promotion territory, the landscape shifts overnight. Not someday. Immediately. Watch this closely. The next 12 months could redefine how fight fans watch MMA forever. Watch more fight breakdowns, predictions, and insider takes here. #UFC #MMA #JakePaul #Netflix #CombatSports #FightBusiness #Boxing #MMAFights #FightNews

articles.title: Pereira‚Äôs Heavyweight Move: UFC White House
articles.description: Alex Pereira is walking around at 242 pounds. That‚Äôs not rumor ‚Äî that‚Äôs what he says he weighs when he‚Äôs training. So what does that mean? Is Pereira fighting at light heavyweight at the White House? Or is he moving to heavyweight? And if he moves ‚Äî is it for the interim belt‚Ä¶ or the undisputed belt? Because if it‚Äôs not undisputed, does it even count toward champ-champ-champ status? There‚Äôs a reason Pereira isn‚Äôt mentioning certain names.There‚Äôs a reason heavyweight keeps coming up. And there‚Äôs a reason Jon Jones talk may finally be over. If Pereira fights for the heavyweight title at the White House‚Ä¶ that changes everything. ‚è± TIMESTAMPS 0:00 Pereira at 242 Pounds1:05 White House Title Fight?2:00 Light Heavyweight or Heavyweight?3:05 What He‚Äôs NOT Saying4:10 Why Olberg‚Äôs Name Matters5:05 Champ Champ Champ Debate6:20 Interim Belt vs Undisputed7:30 The Jon Jones Question8:45 Nick Diaz Marketing Example10:15 Would Interim Even Count?11:30 Why This Would Main Event12:20 Is Pereira Fighting Undisputed? articles.title: Nick Diaz & Joe Riggs Hospital Fight, What Happened Afterwards...
articles.description: Nick Diaz and Joe Riggs had a war in the octagon. Then they fought again‚Ä¶ in the hospital. This isn‚Äôt rumor. This isn‚Äôt exaggeration. Both men were on gurneys. IVs in their arms. Cornermen surrounding them. One comment sparked it. ‚ÄúLet‚Äôs do round four.‚Äù What happened next involved punches, a missing tooth, ripped IVs, blood everywhere‚Ä¶ and a backstage kick that got Dana White furious. It‚Äôs one of the most legendary stories in MMA history. articles.title: Daniel Cormier GUARANTEES Gable Steveson will become UFC champion after TKO win | w/ Ben Askren
articles.description: In the most recent episode of Funky and the Champ with Ben Askren, DC and Ben talk Gable Steveson's 3-0 record in MMA and why he's destined to become a UFC heavyweight champion. Cormier tells Ben he wants Steveson to be careful of not getting thrown in the fire right away. DC feels Gable has superior talent, but needs to work his way up to winning a UFC title. articles.title: Tiki Ghosn Elbows Deen the Great...
articles.description: Deen the Great got into it with Tiki. And it ended fast. This all started days after an awkward moment involving Larry Wheels and Rampage‚Äôs stream. Dean was already in a tense spot. Then he stepped to Tiki. He got in his face. He said he‚Äôd slap him. He said he‚Äôd do it right now. They were inches apart. At that distance, there‚Äôs only two choices: Defend yourself ‚Äî or be a fool. Tiki chose to defend himself. But here‚Äôs the part that matters‚Ä¶ Dean owned it. He apologized. He admitted he started it. He said they were good. That‚Äôs rare. Let‚Äôs talk about what actually happened ‚Äî and why it ended the way it did. ‚è± TIMESTAMPS 0:00 What Happened With Dean & Tiki1:10 The Larry Wheels Incident2:15 The Confrontation With Tiki3:20 Inches Apart4:05 Why Tiki Had to Defend Himself5:10 The Elbow Decision6:20 Why Dean Earned Respect7:10 The Lesson in All This Bad Guy Inc merch now available at https://BadGuyInc.com Click here to subscribe: https://bit.ly/3FrHIPK Follow me on IG: https://bit.ly/3HY7BIE Follow me on Twitter: https://bit.ly/3tvY5J7 Follow me on Threads https://www.threads.com/@sonnench

articles.title: ‚ÄòConor McGregor is BACK!?‚Äô | OFFERRED A UFC FIGHT! (Is it NATE DIAZ?) | BISPING REACTS
articles.description: Conor McGregor says he‚Äôs been offered an opponent and accepted ‚Äî before deleting the tweet ‚Äî and now the question is: who does he fight on the rumored White House card? With Michael Chandler seemingly out of the picture, could it be a trilogy with Nate Diaz, unfinished business with Dustin Poirier, or a massive showdown against Jorge Masvidal?
